```{r}
##install if needed
if(!require("dplyr")) install.packages("dplyr")
if(!require("janitor")) install.packages("janitor")
if(!require("ggplot2")) install.packages("ggplot2")
if(!require("tidyr")) install.packages("tidyr")
if(!require("readr")) install.packages("readr")

##bring in libraries
library(dplyr)
library(janitor)
library(ggplot2)
library(tidyr)
library(readr)

##pull and shrink data
coffee_df <- read_csv("C:/Users/grego/Downloads/coffee_survey.csv")
clean_coffee_df <- mutate(coffee_df, age = case_when(age == "<18 years old" ~ "0-17 years old", TRUE ~ age)) # Make <18 properly alphabetized
clean_coffee_df <- clean_coffee_df[!apply(clean_coffee_df[, -1], 1, function(x) all(is.na(x))), ] #remove data if everything is NA


##exploring data
new_coffee_df <- select(clean_coffee_df, age, additions, everything())
new_coffee_df <- filter(new_coffee_df, !is.na(age))
new_coffee_df <- arrange(new_coffee_df, age, additions)

new_coffee_df <- slice_sample(new_coffee_df, n = 41 )# I chose 41 becaseu that is the max rows visible on my screen

summarise(group_by(new_coffee_df, age), additions)

##try to make graph with y being percentage and x being age --> age being each section of bars, and addition being each bar within each section
```
